metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18922 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that websockets.c in LibVNCServer prior to 0.9.12 did not properly decode certain WebSocket frames. A malicious attacker could exploit this by sending specially crafted WebSocket frames to a server, causing a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.13+dfsg-1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.13+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.13+dfsg-1').
veyon package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
x11vnc package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
